column4: can somebody hold my hand for a minute? Im not sure if my g3dlibs are installing correctly.. the instructions at http://g3d-cpp.sourceforge.net/manual/guideunix.html .. everything builds without error except for one tiny thing... When i look to /usr/local I dont see a /G3D-7.00/ directory.. its like the Install path didnt work...
when you ./configure it ... you need to set the prefix=/where/you/want it to go
do a ./configure --help and read the options
probably at the top
i didnt look at the instructios but thats how it is normally when i compile something
im gonna read the install and see what it says
so when you do that ./buildg3d command it doesnt work? does it output any errors?
apt-get install javacc ??
glad to help
yea you need super user privs
with sudo
sudo <command>
do a sudo -i with nothing after it
Oops
you are in /root now
cd to the directory you were at

ok something is jacked up
you are root it shouldn't deny you anything
do a ls -l build.sh
do what compwiz18 said to do... chmod 755 build.sh
